title: Harrison Yongjoon Youn
text:
Harrison Yongjoon Youn

Economics PhD Candidate The Ohio State University

I’m an Economics PhD candidate researching Labor Economics, Health Economics, and Economics of Science and Innovation. My research leverages electronic health record and spatial data to study the intersection of health equity and urban nature. My journalism and community projects value the partnership between open science tools and data literacy as a way to build power and effect change.


{{< fa brands github >}} {{< fa brands twitter >}} {{< fa brands linkedin >}} {{< fa envelope >}} Contact Me



Research interests that drive my work


Labor Economics


Health Economics


Economics of Science & Innovation




Currently seeking opportunities for collaboration on projects related to health equity, spatial data analysis, and economics research.
Feel free to reach out at youn.40@osu.edu or connect with me on LinkedIn.

title: Harrison Yongjoon Youn
text:
Research Interests
My research spans several key areas in economics:

Labor Economics

Understanding employment dynamics, wage determination, and labor market policies

Health Economics

Examining the intersection of health outcomes and economic factors

Economics of Science and Innovation

Analyzing how economic incentives shape scientific research and technological advancement

title: Harrison Yongjoon Youn
text:
Contact
I’m always interested in discussing research collaborations and opportunities. Feel free to reach out through any of the channels above, or drop me an email at youn.25@osu.edu.
Currently based in Columbus, Ohio
